snippet: Marcel-Lehel Lazar, whose pseudonym celebrated “the style of Gucci and the light of Lucifer,” rampaged through the email of rich Americans, showing the ease of going rogue online.
abstract: Interview with Marcel-Lehel Lazar, hacker known as Guccifer, reveals man with no expertise in computers and no special skills beyond what he had picked up on the web; Lazar's two-year rampage through email accounts of rich and powerful Americans shows how easy it can be to go rogue on the Internet and stay one step ahead of the law, at least for a while, armed with only rudimentary skills.
lead_paragraph: Marcel-Lehel Lazar, whose pseudonym celebrated “the style of Gucci and the light of Lucifer,” rampaged through the email of rich Americans, showing the ease of going rogue online.

headline.main: For Guccifer, Hacking Was Easy. Prison Is Hard.
headline.print_headline: For Guccifer, Hacking Was Easy. Prison Is Hard.
